tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Shoplifting: Whos Paying the Price? - Tonight
programme.desc: As shoplifting rates hit the highest ever recorded in the UK, Paul Brand speaks to those affected and investigates what is being done to tackle the problem.

programme.title: Union Black - Fresh Cuts 2025
programme.desc: A lighthearted but honest insight into the relationship between the UKs Black African and Caribbean communities in a celebration of culture, camaraderie, and Black Britain.

programme.title: Shop on TV
programme.desc: Indulge in a world of incredible deals and must-have products.

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole rides an Indian Scout across the North Wessex Downs to a bijou motor museum in Calne, celebrates the Brough Superior SS100, and tries to get a Norton Nemesis going.

programme.title: Night Vision
programme.desc: Night Vision

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as Dami takes to the hot seat and hopes to beat the tight-fisted Banker at his own game.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: News, current affairs and lively debate.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Ranvir speaks to Hollywood star Benedict Cumberbatch, the best High Street party tops, and Wicked star Cynthia Erivo is in the studio!

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Sharon Marshall gets all the gossip from the Corriedale set, Alan Carr tells us about series 3 of Changing Ends, and Shirlie Kemp gives her take on Martins time Down Under.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Join the Loose Women team as they interview celebrity guests and discuss topical issues.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: News bulletins from ITV News.

programme.title: STV News
programme.desc: The STV National News covering all of Scotland.

programme.title: Sara Davies Christmas Craft Off
programme.desc: Sara Davies puts Olly Smith and Scarlette Douglas to the festive test with Christmas crafts galore ranging from upcycling baubles to painting wine glasses.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Battling it out this time are siblings-in-law Inka and Alex from London and Hastings, workmates Jeni and Mia from Croydon and Liverpool, and pals Jenny and Kim from Kent.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Lee joins Stephen Mulhern as he tries to take on the Bankers cunning offers and stay strong to bring a big red home to his family.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as all that stands between Steve from Leicestershire, Meg from Doncaster, Debs from Norfolk, Tom from London and thousands of pounds is a Chaser.

programme.title: STV News at Six
programme.desc: STV News from Glasgow and the West.

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: National and international news with reports and analysis from ITVs Correspondents.

programme.title: Whats on Scotland
programme.desc: Laura Boyd and Emma Cameron look at whats creating a buzz around Scotland this week.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Anyas condition worsens, Vinny sees through Lewis false positivity, and Kev is surprised.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla blames Becky for sabotaging her romantic plans, Theo runs into a replacement for Todd, and Abi lashes out at Tracy in front of Kevin.

programme.title: Im a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: The celebrities are settling into jungle life away from their home comforts and trying to go the distance in the hope of becoming King or Queen of the Jungle.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: The days national and international news with a fresh perspective.

programme.title: STV News
programme.desc: The STV National News covering all of Scotland.

programme.title: Champions: Full Gallop
programme.desc: Documentary series. The Trainers title race goes down to the wire as Willie Mullins and Dan Skelton try to etch their names into racing folklore.

programme.desc: Indulge in a world of incredible deals and must-have products.

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole rides through the Cotswolds, tells the story of the Yamaha V-Max, meets top rider Maria Costello and finishes restoring the Suzuki JiXR.

programme.title: Night Vision
programme.desc: Night Vision

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Lee joins Stephen Mulhern as he tries to take on the Bankers cunning offers and stay strong to bring a big red home to his family.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James is bringing his culinary tour of the UK to his neck of the woods as he spends precious time in his adopted home county of Hampshire.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team of experts travel the country to find dream gardens.

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan are Sir Brian May, Phil Tufnell, and Denise Black to provide the chat while horticulturalist Camilla Bassett-Smith shows how to heat up greenhouses.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: News bulletins from ITV News.

programme.title: James Martins Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James serves up a feast for broadcaster Nicky Campbell, enjoys recipes from chefs Emily Scott and Stephen Terry, and tastes cocktails from First Datess Merlin Griffiths.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: News bulletins from ITV News.

programme.title: Champions: Full Gallop
programme.desc: Documentary series. The Trainers title race goes down to the wire as Willie Mullins and Dan Skelton try to etch their names into racing folklore.

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Haydock
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of racing from Haydock and Ascot - the feature race is the Grade One Betfair Chase which will see leading staying chasers back in action.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Looking back at Tipping Points most thrilling end games as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its jackpot.

programme.title: Bullseye
programme.desc: Three more teams take on the classic darts-based game show as world number one Luke Humphries partners with host Freddie Flintoff to try to complete a charity challenge.

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: National and international news with reports and analysis from ITVs Correspondents.

programme.title: STV News
programme.desc: The STV National News covering all of Scotland.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as singer Lance Ellington, gymnast Beth Tweddle, jockey Bob Champion and actress Sally Lindsay take on the challenge and hope to win thousands of pounds.

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity special of the classic game show with Ben Bailey Smith, Claire Richards, and Lisa Riley all trying to guess well-known phrases in aid of charity.

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Find out how clever you are as Lee Mack presents the quiz where it doesnt matter how good you are at quizzes and where 100 contestants could win up to 100,000 pounds.

programme.title: Im a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Were back in Australia as we get the latest instalment from life in the camp - the celebrities have endured one week, but they must try to go the distance.

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathans Parents Evening
programme.desc: Things get tense as Alison Hammond and her son Aidan, Iain Stirling and his mum Alison, and Carol Vorderman and her son Cameron expose their faith in each other.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show: Special Guests
programme.desc: The guests featured with Jonathan in this show include Tom Hanks, Bradley Cooper, Sandra Bullock, Denzel Washington, Cilla Black, Ed Sheeran and Suranne Jones.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: News bulletins from ITV News.

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from across the Football League including Charlton Athletic v Southampton, Coventry City v West Bromwich Albion, and Leicester City v Stoke City in the Championship.
